lessonInfo.title: Web Development Level 1 - Lesson 7
lessonInfo.description: Box Model, CSS Grid, and Layouts

parts.title: Part 1 - The Box Model
parts.description: Learn about the CSS box model and how padding, border, and margin affect element sizing. Understand box-sizing: border-box for better layout control.
keyConcepts: Every HTML element is a box
Padding creates space inside a box
Border creates space around the box
Margin creates space outside the box
box-sizing: border-box prevents boxes from growing

question1.text: If a div has width: 100px, padding: 10px, and border: 1px, what is its total width by default?

options.text: Keeps the box at its set width, including padding and border

question3.text: Which CSS property does NOT affect the total size of a box by default?

parts.title: Part 2 - CSS Grid
parts.description: Learn how to create modern webpage layouts using CSS Grid. Understand rows, columns, and how to structure content for professional-looking websites.
keyConcepts: CSS Grid creates rows and columns
Grid is perfect for creating structured layouts

question1.text: What CSS property do you use to enable grid layout?

question2.text: What is the difference between rows and columns?

options.text: Rows go left to right, columns go top to bottom
Rows go top to bottom, columns go left to right
Rows are for text, columns are for images

question3.text: Which property defines the column structure in CSS Grid?

parts.title: Part 3 - Styling with Grid
parts.description: Continue building a real webpage layout using CSS Grid. Practice creating structured sections and styling them to look professional.
keyConcepts: Combining grid with padding and margin
Styling grid items for visual appeal

question1.text: When styling a grid layout, what should you consider?

options.text: Grid structure, spacing, and visual styling

question2.text: What makes a webpage layout look professional?

parts.title: Part 4 - Navigation Bars
parts.description: Learn how to create navigation bars that help users move around your website. Finish your webpage with professional navigation and final touches.
keyConcepts: Navigation bars help users navigate websites
Navigation should be consistent across pages

question1.text: Why is navigation important on a website?

options.text: It makes the site look prettier
It helps users move between different pages
It makes the site load faster

question2.text: What is a good CSS layout algorithm to use for Navigation menus?
